tit.e: Usa jingu Goshin Noh (Noh play at Usa-jingu Shrine)
Usa-jingu Goshin Noh (Noh play at Usa-jingu Shrine)
Usa-jingu Goshin Noh (Noh play at Usa-jingu Shrine)

sen.j: 宇佐神宮御神能（うさじんぐうごしんのう）は、大分県宇佐市の宇佐神宮で、毎年10月20日、21日に行われる風除報賽祭（ふうじょほうさいさい）の2日目に奉納される能である。
sen.e: Usa jingu Goshin Noh is a Noh play that is dedicated at Usa-jingu Shrine (Usa City, Oita Prefecture) on second day of fujo hosai festival (a festival of giving thanks to a shrine for grain of the field having been protected from storm and flood damage or from disease and harmful insects), held on October 20 and 21 every year.
sen.cmt: 長くなり分かりにくくなってしまうので、「大分県宇佐市」を括弧内に補足として宇佐神宮につけました。
sen.e: Usa-jingu Goshin Noh is a Noh play dedicated at Usa-jingu Shrine (Usa City, Oita Prefecture) on the second day of fujo hosai festival (a festival of giving thanks to a shrine for grain of the field having been protected from storm and flood damage or from disease and harmful insects), held on October 20 and 21 every year.
sen.cmt: Usa-jingu Goshin Nohとし、that is dedicated→dedicated、on second day→on the second dayとしました。
sen.e: Usa-jingu Goshin Noh is a Noh play dedicated at Usa-jingu Shrine (Usa City, Oita Prefecture) on the second day of fujo hosai festival (a festival of giving thanks to a shrine for grain of the field having been protected from storm and flood damage or from disease and harmful insects), held on October 20 and 21 every year.

sen.j: 1975年3月28日に大分県の無形文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: It is designated as an intangible cultural properties of Oita Prefecture, since March 28, 1975.
It is designated as an intangible cultural property of Oita Prefecture, since March 28, 1975.
sen.cmt: an intangible cultural properties→an intangible cultural propertyとしました。
sen.e: It is designated as an intangible cultural property of Oita Prefecture, since March 28, 1975.

sen.j: 風除報賽祭は、宇佐神宮に伝わる多くの祭事のうちのひとつ。
sen.e: Fujo hosai festival is one of many festival passed down in Usa-jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Fujo hosai festival is one of many festival passed down in Usa-jingu Shrine.
Fujo hosai festival is one of many festival passed down in Usa-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 作物が風水害等から護られ、五穀豊穣となったことを神に感謝する祭事である。
sen.e: It is a festival of giving thanks to god for the productiveness of grain and grain of the field having been protected from storm and flood damage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is a festival of giving thanks to god for the productiveness of grain and grain of the field having been protected from storm and flood damage.
It is a festival of giving thanks to god for the productiveness of grain and grain of the field having been protected from storm and flood damage.

sen.j: 毎年10月20日、21日の両日に行われる。
sen.e: The festival is held on October 20 and 21 every year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The festival is held on October 20 and 21 every year.
The festival is held on October 20 and 21 every year.

sen.j: 御神能はこのうち第2日目の21日に宇佐神宮境内にある能楽堂で奉納される。
sen.e: Goshin Noh (Noh play) is dedicated at Noh Theatre in precincts of Usa-jingu Shrine on October 21, the second day of the festival.
Goshin Noh (Noh play) is dedicated at Noh Theatre in precincts of Usa-jingu Shrine on October 21, the second day of the festival.
Goshin Noh (Noh play) is dedicated at Noh Theatre in precincts of Usa-jingu Shrine on October 21, the second day of the festival.

sen.j: なお、第1日目の20日には俚舞楽打（さとまいがくうち）が宇佐神宮勅使門前の斎庭で奉納される。
sen.e: In addition, Sato maigaku uchi is dedicated at funeral hall in front of Usa-jingu Shrine Chokushi-mon gate (the gate for the Imperial Envoys) on October 20, the first day of the festival.
In addition, Sato maigaku uchi is dedicated at funeral hall in front of Usa-jingu Shrine Chokushi-mon gate (the gate for the Imperial Envoys) on October 20, the first day of the festival.
In addition, Sato maigaku uchi is dedicated at funeral hall in front of Usa-jingu Shrine Chokushi-mon gate (the gate for the Imperial Envoys) on October 20, the first day of the festival.

sen.j: 宇佐神宮の御神能は、安元年間（1175年 - 1177年）に猿楽として始まったものであると伝えられている。
sen.e: It is believed that Goshin Noh of Usa jingu started around 1175-1177, as a sarugaku (comical mimicry and speech performance in Heian period).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is believed that Goshin Noh of Usa jingu started around 1175-1177, as a sarugaku (comical mimicry and speech performance in Heian period).
It is believed that Goshin Noh of Usa jingu started around 1175-1177, as a sarugaku (comical mimicry and speech performance in Heian period).

sen.j: 以後、応永22年（1415年）の大内義弘による中興等の盛衰を経て、関ヶ原の戦の後に中津藩に入封した細川忠興のもとで元和 (日本)5年（1619年）に再興された。
sen.e: Through some vicissitudes in later days, such as a restoration in 1415 by Yoshihiro OUCHI, Tadaoki HOSOKAWA who entered in Nakatsu Domain after the Battle of Sekigahara retorted it in 1619.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Through some vicissitudes in later days, such as a restoration in 1415 by Yoshihiro OUCHI, Tadaoki HOSOKAWA who entered in the Nakatsu Domain after the Battle of Sekigahara retorted it in 1619.
Through some vicissitudes in later days, such as a restoration in 1415 by Yoshihiro OUCHI, Tadaoki HOSOKAWA who entered in the Nakatsu Domain after the Battle of Sekigahara retorted it in 1619.

sen.j: 以来、約390年にわたって毎年絶えることなく奉納されてきた。
sen.e: Since then, it has been dedicated every year for approximately 390 years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Since then, it has been dedicated every year for approximately 390 years.
Since then, it has been dedicated every year for approximately 390 years.

sen.j: 能は観世流、狂言は大蔵流の系統をくむものである。
sen.e: Noh is in line of Kanze school, and Kyogen (farce played during a Noh cycle) is in line of Okura school.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Noh is in line of Kanze school, and Kyogen (farce played during a Noh cycle) is in line of Okura school.
Noh is in line of Kanze school, and Kyogen (farce played during a Noh cycle) is in line of Okura school.

sen.j: 宇佐観世とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Usa Kanze.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is also called Usa Kanze.
It is also called Usa Kanze.

sen.j: 現在では、宇佐神宮の氏子が主体の宇佐神宮神能会によって毎年違う演目が演じられる。
sen.e: Presently, different program is played by Usa-jingu Shrine shin Noh kai (Usa-jingu Shrine shin noh society) that main body is Uji-jingu Shrin's ujiko (shrine parishioner).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Presently, different program is played by Usa-jingu Shrine shin Noh kai (Usa-jingu Shrine shin noh society) that main body is Usa-jingu Shrine's ujiko (shrine parishioner).
Presently, different program is played by Usa-jingu Shrine shin Noh kai (Usa-jingu Shrine shin noh society) that main body is Usa-jingu Shrine's ujiko (shrine parishioner).

sen.j: しかし、『清経』のみは演じられない慣わしとなっている。
sen.e: However "Kiyotsune" (a Noh piece) is not played as a tradition.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However "Kiyotsune" (a Noh piece) is not played as a tradition.
However "Kiyotsune" (a Noh piece) is not played as a tradition.

sen.j: 神前で奉納する能楽（御神能）としては、厳島神社の桃花祭御神能と並んで日本を代表するものである。
sen.e: It is a leading Goshin Noh (Nogaku play dedicated to before the gods) along with Tokasai (a festival of offering peach blossoms to the enshrined deity) Goshin Noh of Itsukushima-jinja Shrine.
It is a leading Goshin Noh (Nogaku play dedicated to before the gods) along with Tokasai (a festival of offering peach blossoms to the enshrined deity) Goshin Noh of Itsukushima-jinja Shrine.
It is a leading Goshin Noh (Nogaku play dedicated to before the gods) along with Tokasai (a festival of offering peach blossoms to the enshrined deity) Goshin Noh of Itsukushima-jinja Shrine.
